name: chicano
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone, especially a man or boy, who was born in the US and whose family comes from Mexico: Since the 1920s or earlier, Chicanos in Texas have been making what came to be called burritos. He wrote about what it means to be a Chicano. Compare
Chicana
Chicanx
Latino
More examplesFewer examplesMany Mexican-Americans or Chicanos wanted to preserve the language of their parents.Shared religious experiences among Chicanos have resulted in the creation of religious folk art.I'm not a typical kind of American and I'm not Mexican either, but I'm a Chicano.
born in the US and part of a family that comes from Mexico, or relating to people born in the US with families from Mexico: The story is told from the point of view of a Chicano teenager. These images are found in murals in Chicano communities across the United States. He is a passionate collector of Chicano art.
More examplesFewer examplesShe's a Chicano author and a language professor.These design motifs are distinctive to Chicano cemeteries.Home altars are common in many Mexican and Chicano homes.Sometimes this kind of speech is called Chicano Spanish.He helped to popularize a hybrid style of bilingual Chicano or Mexican-American music.
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person living in the US who was born in Mexico or whose parents came from Mexico
